title: College football's most unbreakable records, from Barry Sanders to Bobby Bowden
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Israel pounds Iran: Ayatollah on the brink - will Khameneiâ€™s regime implode?
content: Iran faces internal and external pressures. Israeli strikes eliminate key Iranian military figures. This exposes vulnerabilities. Khamenei's inner circle is weakened. Popular rage simmers. Khamenei's son consolidates power. Loyalty within the regime cracks. Military doctrine fails. The regime faces a historic crisis. It is a crisis of power and survival. The next week is crucial.

title: IND vs ENG: Playing XI cues from the nets - Karun Nair likely to play in Leeds
content: Ahead of the first Test against England, Team India had an optional net session in Leeds. While key players like Pant and Bumrah skipped the session, Rahul, Jaiswal, and Gill had extensive practice. Karun Nair is likely to return to the Playing XI for the Headingley Test on Friday, June 20.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is forcing thousands of corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle, Arlington, and Washington DC. Employees receive 30 days to decide and 60 days to relocate or resign without severance. The mandate coincides with CEO Andy Jassy's warning that AI will shrink Amazon's workforce, potentially prompting voluntary departures as a cost-cutting measure.

title: AI-171 crash: 'Aircraft, its engines showed no issues before flight,' says Air India CEO
content: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson affirmed that the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner involved in the June 12 crash was meticulously maintained. Enhanced pre-flight safety checks are now implemented across the 787 fleet, following a DGCA directive. Wilson stated that 26 of 33 aircraft have been cleared after inspections. A temporary reduction in widebody operations is a precautionary measure.

title: 5 Assembly bypolls: High voter turnout in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala
content: Bypolls across five Assembly segments in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala saw varied voter turnouts, with West Bengal's Kaliganj leading at nearly 70%. Largely peaceful, the polls were necessitated by MLA deaths and resignations. Key contests included those in Nilambur (Kerala), Visavadar and Kadi (Gujarat), and Ludhiana West (Punjab). The Election Commission implemented webcasting and mobile-phone deposit facilities.

title: Steve Jobsâ€™ expensive gift: When Apple founder gifted Jaguar to secretary; said â€˜donâ€™t beâ€¦â€™
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: IND vs ENG: How to bat in England? Tendulkar shares tips for Indian batting
content: Sachin Tendulkar, whose name now features on the England-India Test series trophy alongside Jimmy Anderson, shared insights on Indiaâ€™s inexperienced batting unit, the Bazball challenge, and the England seamer's legacy. He urged India to focus on winning sessions as the Test series begins at Headingley on June 20. The Master Blaster also reflected on cricket's evolution and explained what made Anderson special.

title: IND vs ENG: Can Bazball outplay India's new era? Key battles and what to expect
content: England's 'Bazball' approach faces its ultimate test in a five-Test series against India. While the aggressive strategy has brought success, vulnerabilities remain, including over-reliance on Joe Root, an inexperienced bowling attack post-Anderson and Broad, and a still-unsettled spin department. India's seasoned players and diverse attack will probe these weaknesses, questioning whether England can adapt when their high-risk philosophy is challenged.

title: AI is your intern today: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to software engineers; but soon â€¦
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions AI evolving from an 'intern' to a seasoned software engineer, potentially revolutionizing coding roles. He anticipates AI agents tackling complex business problems and discovering new knowledge soon. While this shift demands software engineers focus on AI management and innovation, concerns arise about AI's impact on employment, with predictions of significant job displacement in white-collar sectors.

title: India bleeds Pak dry: Water at â€˜deadâ€™ levels; bigger Indus plans - top points
content: Following the Indus Waters Treaty suspension, India is optimizing the Indus river system, looking to construct a 113-km canal to redirect water to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This inter-basin transfer aims to maximize water usage from eastern rivers and fully utilize India's share of western rivers, potentially limiting Pakistan's water access.

title: 'Will evacuate Indians who wish to leave Israel,' says MEA- check details
content: Amidst the escalating Iran-Israel crisis, the Indian government has decided to evacuate Indian nationals from Israel who wish to return. Travel will be facilitated via land borders and then by air to India. Registration details and contact information for the Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv have been provided for assistance.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria MonÃ©t in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria MonÃ©t's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted MonÃ©t's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: IND vs ENG: Cook's big statement on Virat-Rohit exit - 'Now there's a clean slate ...'
content: Former England skipper Alastair Cook observes that Virat Kohli and captain Rohit Sharma's Test retirements mark a significant shift in India's dressing room dynamics, creating a 'clean slate' for new leadership under Shubman Gill. Despite their recent form decline, Kohli and Sharma's absence removes unchallenged authority, potentially impacting team culture.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Five-time Pro Bowl linebacker CJ Mosley retires from NFL
content: C.J. Mosley, the former Baltimore Ravens standout and New York Jets defensive leader, has retired after a decade in the NFL. Drafted by Baltimore in 2014, Mosley earned four Pro Bowls before joining the Jets in 2019. Despite injuries, he anchored New York's defense, amassing over 1,000 tackles and showcasing exceptional leadership throughout his career.

title: India kicks off much-needed review of arms procurement procedures
content: India has initiated a comprehensive review of its Defence Acquisition Procedure 2020 to expedite weapon system procurement, promote self-reliance, and increase private sector involvement. The review aims to streamline processes, align with 'Atmanirbharta' goals, and encourage indigenous technology infusion.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut â€“ How past Indian skippers fared
content: Shubman Gill, at 25, is set to captain India in Test cricket for the first time against England at Headingley. The article revisits the debut Test matches of previous Indian captains, highlighting their varied experiences. From Kohli's aggressive start with centuries to Ganguly's commanding win, each leader carved a unique path.

title: â€˜City killerâ€™ asteroid may hit the Moon in Dec 2032 could threaten satellites around Earth
content: Asteroid 2024 YR4, though not an Earth threat, now poses a collision risk to the Moon. Scientists estimate a 4.3% chance of impact, potentially ejecting 100 million kilograms of lunar debris into space. This debris could endanger satellites in low Earth orbit, crucial for communication, GPS, and climate monitoring, necessitating international attention and preparedness.

title: Who is Sophie Cunningham? Viral WNBA moment shows her fierce defense of Caitlin Clark
content: In a WNBA game, Sophie Cunningham defended Caitlin Clark after a foul. Cunningham's action led to her ejection and went viral. Fans praised her, and her jersey sales surged. Cunningham, known for her defense, became a fan favorite. The Fever won the game. Now, Cunningham is recognized as 'The Enforcer'. Everyone is watching her support for Clark.

title: Deja vu diplomacy: Why Trump's Iran gamble feels like Bush's worst mistake
content: Now, in 2025, Trumpworld believes a single strike on Fordo â€” Iranâ€™s heavily fortified nuclear site â€” will miraculously solve the nuclear crisis. Supporters like John Bolton urge, â€œBomb Fordo and be done with it,â€ echoing the casual fatalism of Iraqâ€™s early architects. Tulsi Gabbard, now Director of National Intelligence, has said Iran isn't actively building a bomb. Trumpâ€™s response? â€œI donâ€™t care what she said.â€

title: Mumbai: Rs 25 crore worth of hydroponic weed seized at airport; 3 arrested
content: Mumbai airport customs seized hydroponic weed worth approximately Rs 25 crore. Officials arrested three individuals. Coimbatore airport officials previously seized 5.25kg of hydroponic weed worth Rs 5 crore. A Kerala native was arrested for smuggling from Bangkok. Hydroponic ganja has a high THC content, making it potent. NCB notes its limited prevalence compared to synthetic drugs.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Sanjay Verma under scanner, cops probe 200+ calls with Sonam
content: The murder of businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya takes a twist with the emergence of 'Sanjay Verma,' a possible alias used by Sonam Raghuvanshi's alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. Police are investigating a potential financial motive linked to a major contract Raja secured. Reenactment of the crime revealed a second weapon and Sonam's presence during the attack.

title: 'Created to build nukes': IDF gives closer look at nuclear reactor in Iran- watch
content: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) released a video claiming Iran was using the Arak nuclear reactor to develop nuclear weapons, stating it neutralized the reactor in a recent attack. Iranian state TV confirmed the attack, noting the site was evacuated beforehand, posing no radiation threat. This action retaliated against Iran's strike on an Israeli hospital.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill plays cards close to his chest on India XI; reveals speaking to Rohit, Virat
content: Shubman Gill, the new Test captain, expressed his honour at leading India and confirmed he would bat at No.4, filling Virat Kohli's spot. He emphasized creating a secure team environment and backing young players. While keeping the playing XI flexible based on pitch conditions, Gill hinted at an evolving team identity to be revealed later in the series.

title: SC panel proposes impeachment of Justice Varma - What probe report said
content: A high court judge, Yashwant Varma, faces potential impeachment after an inquiry found him and his family had control over a store room where burnt cash was discovered. The inquiry committee, led by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu, found serious misconduct, leading to a recommendation for Justice Varma's removal by former CJI Sanjiv Khanna.

title: Paulina Gretzky shares rare family moment on son Riverâ€™s birthday
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and wife of golfer Dustin Johnson, recently gave fans a peek into her family life with a heartfelt Instagram post celebrating her younger son Riverâ€™s 7th birthday. The image revealed a stylish yet intimate setting. This underscores the coupleâ€™s deep commitment to parenting amid fame.

title: Who is Karen Read? Boston woman acquitted of murdering cop boyfriend in 2022
content: Karen Read was acquitted of murder and manslaughter in the death of her boyfriend, Boston police officer John O'Keefe, but found guilty of OUI. The verdict, delivered after a retrial, sparked contrasting reactions, with Read's supporters celebrating and O'Keefe's family decrying a miscarriage of justice.

title: Shots fired near Tejashwi Yadavâ€™s house in Patna
content: In Patna, just a day before Prime Minister Modi's visit to Bihar, gunfire erupted in a high-security zone near the residences of top officials, including the Chief Minister and Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav. Two assailants on a motorcycle opened fire, prompting a police investigation and raising concerns about security.

title: Andersonâ€“Tendulkar Trophy: Indiaâ€“England series enters new era, tribute to legends
content: In a historic move, the BCCI and ECB have announced the Andersonâ€“Tendulkar Trophy, replacing the Pataudi and Anthony De Mello Trophies, for Test series between India and England. This new title honours James Anderson and Sachin Tendulkar, celebrating their immense contributions to cricket.

title: Delhi schools rise in rankings: 44-point jump in PGI 2.0; What drove the big score boost?
content: Delhi has improved its Performance Grading Index (PGI) score by 44 points, moving from Akanshi-1 to Prachesta-3 in the 2023â€“24 evaluation released by the Ministry of Education. The capital made notable gains in infrastructure and governance, while maintaining strong performance in equity. However, learning outcomes and access showed limited improvement. Delhiâ€™s progress reflects broader national trends, with 24 states and UTs improving their PGI scores, though only Chandigarh reached the Prachesta-1 grade.

title: Trump questions Juventus on women in menâ€™s team; players exchange awkward glances
content: During a White House visit, Juventus players and staff faced an awkward situation when Donald Trump steered their ceremonial event into a political discussion. He questioned the team about transgender athletes in women's sports, following a Supreme Court ruling on gender-affirming care. Trump's focus on this issue aligns with his second-term agenda, including policies restricting transgender participation in women's sports.

title: Karnataka mulls bill on crowd control post Bengaluru stampede
content: Following a tragic stampede in Bengaluru that claimed 11 lives, the Karnataka government is planning to introduce a bill focused on crowd control and management. Other proposed legislation includes the Rohith Vemula Bill, aimed at preventing caste-based discrimination, along with measures to combat misinformation, fake news, hate speech, and hate crimes.

title: US judge blocks Trump administration's â€˜Passport Gender Policyâ€™
content: In a landmark decision, a US federal court has blocked the State Department from enforcing a policy that restricted passport gender markers to birth-assigned sex. Judge Julia E. Kobick's ruling extends to individuals not identifying with their birth gender, allowing them to obtain passports reflecting their gender identity.

title: Mid East crisis: Khamenei 'can no longer be allowed to exist,' warns Israel
content: Israel issued a stark warning to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. They said he cannot continue to exist. This followed Iranian retaliatory strikes, including an attack on an Israeli hospital. The conflict has escalated with attacks on nuclear facilities. Casualties are mounting on both sides. The US has stated it has no plans to target Khamenei for now.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 4: Who's the new No. 1?
content: four teams are 2-1, while the other four are 1-2 . the redwoods jump into a top spot after a 12-11 win over California last week . they have the no. 1 scoring defense in the PLL, but they are winning just 38% of their faceoffs .

title: How the Thunder win it all and the Pacers force Game 7
content: Shams Charania and Brian Windhorst break down what Tyrese Haliburton could mean for the Pacers heading into game 6 . the 2025 finals are one step closer to crowning a new champion . a strained right calf and will undergo an MRI .

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: 16 nations will compete at euro 2025 in Switzerland for the chance to be crowned european champions . the stakes are higher than ever, with prize money more than doubled compared with the previous tournament . each federation receives at least â‚¬1.8 million and required to allocate at least 30% to players .

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: NFL execs, scouts pick their favorite offseason moves: Where Rodgers, Pickens rate
content: twenty-eight teams are officially off for the summer, with the frenzied nature of transactions fading into the background . this week's minicamp is the ideal time to take stock of the splash moves around the league . a few potential moves remain on the radar, including a potential Jalen Ramsey trade .

title: Recruiting intel from Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
content: 20 of the nation's top high school quarterbacks convened in Southern California for the Elite 11 Finals . from Tuesday night to Thursday morning, 20 headliners convene in southern California . among the headliners are five-star passers in the 2026 ESPN 300 . a final round of official visits before the recruiting dead period from June 23 to July 31 .

title: Why one Hall of Fame sidekick sees a lot of himself in OKC's Jalen Williams
content: HE WAS A no-star recruit coming out of high school, landing at a small college before a sudden growth spurt . he didn't register on scouts' radars until a couple of years later . this once unheralded prospect just kept getting better after arriving in the NBA .

title: Meitei Farmer Injured In Shooting By Suspected Kuki Insurgents, Kuki Woman Killed In Crossfire With Security Forces
content: An elderly farmer from the Meitei community was shot at by suspected Kuki insurgents in Manipur's Bishnupur district today, sources told NDTV. The incident happened at 3 pm in a paddy field in Phubala village, they said.

title: Iran Used Ballistic Missile With Multiple Warheads Says Israel: 10 Points
content: The Iran Military has confirmed in a statement on Telegram that it has begun a "new round of combined missile and drone attacks" on military sites in Haifa and Tel Aviv.

title: IIT Graduate Among 15 'Online Sexual Predators' Arrested In Telangana
content: In a major crackdown on online child sexual predators, the Telangana Cyber Security Bureau has arrested 15 people, mostly educated men in their 20s.

title: Indian Money In Swiss Banks Triples On Banking Funds, Highest Since 2021
content: Indian money parked in Swiss banks more than tripled in 2024 to 3.5 billion Swiss francs on the back of a huge jump in funds held through local branches and financial institutions, annual data released by Switzerland's central bank showed.

title: 18-Month-Old Child Injured In Accident Between Audi, Bike In Delhi: Cops
content: An 18-month-old child was injured due to an accident between an Audi car and a motorcyle in southeast Delhi's Hazrat Nizamuddin area on Thursday, an official said.

title: Bypolls For 5 Seats In 4 States Largely Peaceful, High Turnout In Bengal
content: Bypolls were held in five Assembly segments across Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat and Kerala on Thursday, with the Kaliganj seat in West Bengal registering a polling percentage of nearly 70 by 5 pm.

title: Macron Shares PM Modi's "Fighting On Twitter" Viral Joke
content: French President Emmanuel Macron has shared a montage of his meetings with world leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the G7 Summit which took place in Canada's Kananaskis.

title: Aviation Watchdog Warns Air India Over 3 Planes, Says Checks Overdue: Report
content: India's aviation regulator has warned Air India for breaching safety rules after three of its Airbus planes flew despite being overdue checks on emergency equipment, and for being slow to address the issue, government documents show.

title: Loyal To Congress For 16 Years, Differences Can Be Discussed: Shashi Tharoor
content: Congress's Shashi Tharoor, whose difference of opinion with many of his party leaders over multiple issues has been highlighted in the media over the recent months, played it down today.

title: Drunk Man Climbs Mobile Tower In Karnataka Over Marriage, Property Dispute: Cops
content: In a scene straight out of a film, a 26-year-old drunk man climbed atop a telecom tower in Vijayapura in Karnataka, and refused to climb down due to a family dispute over marriage and property.

title: Amazon To Invest $233 Million In India To Expand Infrastructure, Improve Tech
content: Amazon will invest more than 20 billion rupees ($233 million) in India in 2025 to expand and update its operations infrastructure, develop new technology for its fulfilment network and improve delivery safety, it said on Thursday.

title: Ukraine And Russia Exchange Prisoner In Latest Swap
content: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.

title: "No Free Lunches": J&K Ex-Top Cop Explores 4 Reasons Behind Trump-Munir Meet
content: Former Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police (DGP) Shesh Paul Vaid on Thursday reacted to the recent lunch meeting between US President Donald Trump and Pakistan's Army Chief, Field Marshal General Syed Asim Munir.

title: Opinion: Opinion | It Is The Best Of Times, It Is The Worst Of Times, For Pakistan
content: While Pakistan has always lived by its wits, this time, it faces the unpredictable, transactionalist Donald Trump, a dealmaker with a penchant for sudden surprises (ask Zelensky).

title: 40 Fighter Jets, 100 Bombs: How Israel Struck Iran, Including Key Nuclear Site
content: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) launched a series of airstrikes deep inside Iranian territory overnight on Wednesday, targeting nuclear infrastructure, missile production sites, and air defence systems.

title: Is Meghan, Duchess Of Sussex, Right? Can Dancing, Twerking Really Bring On Labour?
content: The video Meghan Markle was made four years ago when she gave birth to daughter Lilibet, but only released recently.

title: Video: Rider, Woman Die After Speeding Ducati Plunges Into Pit In Greater Noida
content: A 28-year-old man and his friend, 25, were killed when he lost control of a Ducati bike and it careened into a wall of barricades before plunging into a pit in Greater Noida.

title: "Like Sky Was Torn Open": Iranians Recall Chaotic Scenes In Tehran
content: "The first two days were okay, people said it would just end. But then it started escalating and people really started panicking," said Mehran Ataei of the Israeli bombardment of Tehran.

title: "Extremely Dangerous": Russia Warns US Against 'Military Intervention' In Iran-Israel War
content: "We would like to particularly warn Washington against military intervention in the situation, which would be an extremely dangerous step with truly unpredictable negative consequences," Russia's foreign ministry's spokeswoman said.

title: Video: Sticks In Hand, All-Out Brawl Among Kedarnath Pilgrims
content: Viral videos on social media show violent clashes breaking out among tourists on the Kedarnath Yatra route.

title: Hospital bombed, nuclear sites hit: Iran-Israel clash spirals; Netanyahu vows to make 'tyrants' pay
content: Amidst escalating conflict, Iran and Israel exchanged missile strikes, targeting critical infrastructure. US President Trump weighs military action, hinting at potential talks. Operation Sindhu evacuated 110 Indian nationals from Iran. Reports indicate significant casualties in Iran. Russia offers to mediate, while Iran's leader vows no surrender, signaling a complex and volatile situation in the Middle East.

title: 'Have disagreements with some in Congress leadership,' admits Shashi Tharoor
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has acknowledged his differences with the party's leadership, revealing he wasn't invited to campaign in the Nilambur Assembly byelection. Tharoor emphasized resolving issues internally and reaffirmed his commitment to the party's values and workers.

title: Stokes on India Tests: 'No Virat, Rohit or Ashwin, but that doesn't make it easier'
content: England captain Ben Stokes acknowledges the absence of key Indian players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for the upcoming Test series but warns against underestimating India's new squad under Shubman Gill. Stokes praises Jasprit Bumrah and welcomes Chris Woakes' return, highlighting England's strong record with him.
